question: hey! so what do you think?
answer: new haircut?  necklace?  dress?  boots?  boots!

question: oh my god!
answer: i know.

question: i’m gonna miss being able to afford food.
answer: i’m sorry, they just, they just look so good! and the saleswoman was looking at me like, "oh, these are way too expensive for you."

question: hi!
answer: hey.

question: oh my god!  oh monica! those boots are amazing!
answer: they’re mine!

question: yeah well, too bad we’re gonna have to return them.
answer: return them?! shh! they’re gonna hear you!

question: honey, i’m not returning them. okay? i mean i-i know they cost a lot, but i’m going to wear them all the time. you’ll see. besides, i love the compliments. i mean, have you ever had something so beautiful everyone wanted it?
answer: i have you.

question: that’s right, i love you! and-and i’m gonna play with you all the time.
answer: how can you let him talk to your crotch like that?

question: he’s talking to the baby.
answer: ohh! okay! okay, cause when-when he said, "i can’t wait to hear your first words," i thought, "there’s a trick."

question: okay. well, i gotta go you guys. i’ll see you later.
answer: okay.

question: bye.
answer: bye.

question: oh hey rach, listen—hi!
answer: hi.

question: umm, can you do me a favor? i was talkin’ to my sister and she knows you work at ralph lauren…
answer: no, forget it! no way! i am not sending anymore ralph lauren clothes to prison. it is a waste.

question: no-no-no-no-no-no, not her, not her. my youngest sister, dina, she’s really interested in fashion, and she wants to talk to someone successful, y’know, to give her some advice.
answer: i guess i can talk to one of my supervisors…

question: oh no-no-no-no, she wants to talk to you!
answer: really?! oh my god! i’m successful!

question: okay, so will you meet with her?
answer: yes! i’d love to! have her come by the office.

question: great! thanks! you’re gonna love her so much. and—oh, she’s the smartest of all the tribbiani children. hey, y’know the s.a.t’s?
answer: yeah.

question: hey ross! doesn’t ben go to the smithfield day school?
answer: yeah. why?

question: sting has a son that goes there too!
answer: yeah i know; he’s in ben’s class.

question: you knew this and you never said anything?! with all the stupid dinosaur stuff you tell us?!
answer: fine! no more dinosaur stuff! can i talk about fossils?

question: sting’s son, seven years old and there’s a picture.
answer: what are you reading? the kidnappers guide to manhattan private schools?

question: no, it’s new york magazine. it’s an article about the best schools in the city. so how well do you know sting?
answer: uh, i actually haven’t even met him.

question: uh-huh, yeah that’s too bad. i really want to go to his concert friday night, but it’s totally sold out. i know! why don’t you meet him and get tickets?! if you get two i’ll take you.
answer: well actually, i’m picking ben up tomorrow, maybe he’ll be there.

question: hey guys!
answer: hey-hey.

question: hi monica!
answer: hey.

question: hi boots.
answer: see chandler? i’m getting a lot of use out of them already! they’re very practical. see, you can wear them with dresses, with skirts, with pants…

question: wow! they’re beautiful!
they hurt so much!
answer: what?!

question: the guy who made these hates feet and wants to see them die!
answer: well-well you can give them to me! i haven’t felt my feet in years!

question: i can’t! i spent so much money on them and i told chandler that i’d wear them all the time, i just can’t give them away!
answer: well then get your money back and return them!

question: i can’t do that either! the soles’ are already a little scuffed up and the insides are filled with my blood.
answer: hey!

question: hey!
answer: hey i uh just picked up ben from school…

question: i don’t think you did a very thorough job!
answer: i dropped him off at carol’s.  anyway, it turns out that i’m not going to be able to get those tickets though.

question: oh no! why not?
answer: well it turns out that ben and sting’s son do not get along.

question: how come?!
answer: apparently, sting’s son made fun of the fact that ben’s moms are lesbinims.

question: wait! but ross if they don’t get along then you should smooth things over. make them be friends.
answer: phoebe, you can’t force kids to be friends.

question: sure you can! give them some blocks, put them in a playpen!
answer: playpen?! ben’s seven!

question: your kid is seven?!   he’s really small.  please! please get the tickets!
answer: look i’m sorry pheebs, i can’t do it.

question: yes you can! sting says so himself!
answer: what?

question: rosssss can!
answer: look phoebe, i’m sorry it’s just…

question: rossss can!
answer: phoebe, i…

question: here she is! future fashion superstar!
answer: oh joey, i’m hardly a…

question: my little sister dina!
answer: right! hi dina!

question: hi.
answer: nice to meet you.

question: thanks so much for meetin’ with me. joey’s told me so much about you!
answer: this is so exciting for her. well, i’ll let you two fash…ists get down to business.

question: okay. all right dina, well let’s talk about the different areas of fashion that you could get involved in. let’s see, there’s design, but you may need a whole other degree for that. uh, there’s-there’s sales, which is great because you get to travel…
answer: i…i don’t care about fashion! i’m pregnant! and i know you are too, so you gotta help me!

question: ahhhhhhhh!
answer: what’s wrong?

question: honey, we don’t really have to go to this thing tonight do we?
answer: now sweetie, i know you don’t like my office parties, but you can wear your new boots. see? every cloud has a…supple leather lining.

question: i-i don’t-i don’t think that i’m gonna wear the boots tonight.
answer: why not?

question: well y’know, i’m just-i’m just worried that bosses will see them and think they pay you too much money. or! or your assistant will see them and-and want a raise!
answer: do you think i work at some kind of boot pricing company?

question: anyway, i picked up this outfit that i want to wear and the, and the boots don’t really go with it.
answer: you said that you paid all that money because those boots go with skirts, dresses, and pants!

question: fine! if you want me to wear the boots, i’ll wear the boots. in fact, i’ll go into my room right now and y’know try the outfit on.
answer: okay.

question: i-i can’t go in there. i can’t tell him!
answer: honey, it’s going to be okay. he’s been incredibly supportive of me, and if he gets a little upset; that’s what the meatball sub is for.

question: thank you.
answer: okay.

question: hey! it’s my fashion girls!  what’s wrong?
answer: honey, why don’t you sit down? dina has something that she wants to tell you.

question: oh. what’s, what’s going on? is it mom? is she sick? is it dad’s heart? is that a sandwich?
answer: joe, mom and dad are fine…

question: is that a sandwich?!
answer: joey…there’s something that you…should know. dina?

question: i’m pregnant.
answer: what?!

question: well obviously this is a mistake! you can’t be pregnant! because you have to have sex to get pregnant!
answer: joe, i tried to wait until i was 25 like you did!

question: what?! dina…
answer: bub!!!   i can’t believe this! you’re the good one! you went to college! both years! who did this to you?!

question: bobby corso, but he’s a real nice guy. i like him a lot. he’s real funny.
answer: you got pregnant for funny?! dina…if he’s funny…laugh! all right, i’ll be back in a little while! you stay here!

question: why? where are you going?
answer: i can’t look at you right now!

question: wow.
answer: i know.  commercial break

question: oh, there you are ben!
answer: aunt phoebe, what are you doing here?

question: well, i heard you’re having a problem with one of the boys in your class. and so i thought i would just come down here and sit you both down, have a little talk and make it all okay. now umm, the boy’s name is sting’s son.
answer: jack? i hate him! he’s a jerk.

question: now ben, sometimes people may seem like jerks on the outside, but they have famous fathers.
answer: i have to go. my friend doug is waiting for me over there.

question: excuse me. can, can i help you with something?
answer: yes! yes you can, i’m looking for jack’s parents.

question: are you with one of the students?
answer: uh-huh, i’m with ben.

question: are you one of ben’s mothers?
answer: i am one of ben’s mothers. i’m a lesbian. it was, it was difficult coming out to my parents.

question: well hi, i’m jenny boone. i’m the new teacher here.
answer: oh.

question: i’ve only met your partner carol.
answer: ah! okay so that would make me susan.

question: right. are you looking for jack’s parents to discuss the problems he’s having with ben?  yeah. because i really do think the parents should sit down and have a conversation.
answer: yeah! let’s do that!! that-that sounds good. we should sit down and talk, just me, my lover carol, and the stings. umm, how-how will i get in touch with them?

question: oh, their number is on the contact sheet.
answer: uh-huh. uh-huh. umm, could-could i get a copy of that? ‘cause carol threw it out, she lost ours. she’s such a scatterbrain, but man what a hot piece of ass.

question: y’know, that party wasn’t bad.
answer: yeah! i didn’t know there would be dancing. that was a fun surprise!

question: i don’t see any uh, cabs. maybe we should just walk?
answer: oh no, we can’t walk!

question: what honey, it’s like fifteen blocks to the subway. let’s
answer: hey! do you think that we can get to the subway right there if we climb down through the manhole cover?

question: what’s going on?
answer: i can’t walk. okay? okay? these boots were a huge mistake!

question: what?
answer: okay you were right! all right, i never should have bought them! they’re killing me! one toe at a time!

question: so i was right. this is what it feels like to be right.  it’s oddly unsettling.
answer: how are we gonna get home? maybe a piggy-back ride?

question: hop on.
answer: okay. wait, just give me a second, i need to just get my boots off first.  ah…ooh…oohh…ohh…oh god…ohh…oh…ohh…ohhhh…

question: do you ever worry that you’ll be walking and your baby will just like slip out?
answer: what college was that dina?

question: oh my god! bobby!
answer: hi dina. good to see you.

question: joey, what are you doing?
answer: just what needs to be done! dearly beloved, we are gathered here to join this man and this woman…

question: oh joey this is crazy!
answer: don’t interrupt me when i’m talkin’ to god! now where were we? oh right, okay. do you dina, take this man…

question: no!
answer: oh you’ll take ‘em!

question: no i won’t!
answer: hey! you don’t get a say in this!

question: yes i do!
answer: ahhh! i heard "i do", we’re halfway there! okay!  you!

question: all right joey! that is enough!  listen, as beautiful and moving as this ceremony is, it’s not legal. okay? they-they don’t have a marriage license, they don’t have any witnesses, and the groom only has on one shoe!
answer: yeah, he took the other one off and hit me with it.

question: well what am i supposed to do?
answer: you’re supposed to realize that they are adults! and that they can make their own decisions.

question: no they can’t! they were stupid enough to get knocked up!
answer: heyyyyy! contraceptives are not always effective!  right?

question: yeah…we kinda didn’t use any…
answer: oh, come on kids! a little help here!

question: hi!
answer: i’m trudie.

question: uh-huh.
answer: you must be ben’s mum.

question: why else would i be here?
answer: do sit down.

question: i gather jack and ben haven’t been getting along lately.
answer: yeah.

question: i’m told there are two sides to this story, but all i’ve heard is that ben’s a bit of a poo-poo head.
answer: umm, i’m sorry. won’t-won’t jack’s father be joining

question: oh i’m sorry, jack’s father is not available.
answer: uh-hmm. okay. well then, could we reschedule? for say, friday night perhaps at 8 o’clock?

question: oh no, i know that wouldn’t work. my husband’s in concert.
answer: concert. yeah. that does put us in…quite a pickle. because you see i’m very busy before and after the concert, and he’s obviously busy during.

question: so, i guess you and i should talk about jack and ben right now.
answer: unless! unless umm, okay i-i would be willing to go to the concert, umm, all the while thinking about the children of course.

question: are you here for tickets?
answer: oh, thank you. four would be great.

question: i’m not giving concert tickets to someone who’d use their son like this!
answer: oh good! then you’re in luck! ben’s not my son!

question: look, i’ve just pressed a button, triggering a silent alarm. any minute now, the police will be here!
answer: the police? here? a reunion?!

question: okay, ten blocks down. five to go.
answer: oh wait! stop! stop! stop!

question: oh i’m sorry! do you need a break?
answer: my boots in tan! hey! can you get a little closer so i can see the price?

question: i can see it from right here. it’ll cost you one husband.
answer: okay, i’m sorry. i think i can walk the rest of the way now. just-just give me my boots.

question: i don’t have your boots.
answer: well i don’t have them either. where are they?

question: well, why don’t you check in one of my saddlebags while i chew on a bale of hay!
answer: okay.  god well, we gotta go back and get them!

question: honey, are you seriously ever gonna wear the boots again?
answer: okay, i’m never gonna wear them again. i just didn’t get a chance to say goodbye.

question: y’know what? you can say goodbye to the tan ones.
answer: okay.  all right.

question: joey, just because they’re not getting married doesn’t mean this is going to be a disaster. maybe they have a plan!
answer: oh? oh! okay! okay! let’s hear their plan! now, what’s the future look like for dina and bobby?

question: well…i really have high hopes for my band.
answer: you were right. he is funny.

question: hey, now wait a minute! i get when you told people at first that you wanted to be an actor they laughed at you! now come on bobby, why don’t you tell us a little bit about your band?
answer: well it’s just me and my pal rooster, the band’s name is numb nuts.

question: dina, if you’re having a baby you should be married! even if it is to bobby!  dude, that’s not a compliment!
answer: no joey! i knew you wouldn’t be supportive!

question: so whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! what are you gonna do? you’re gonna have the baby and-and raise it by yourself…without a husband?! you can’t be a single mother alone! you’re gonna ruin your life!

question: no! no! no! it’s different for you. you’re so strong and together. you’re not some dumb kid who doesn’t know what she’s doing.
answer: excuse me?

question: one pregnant woman at a time, please! i just want you to be okay.
answer: so forcing her to marry bobby is gonna make that happen?

question: maybe!  well! well…so-so uh, what kind of music does numb nuts—oh forget it! i can’t!
answer: joey, i am scared to death about this. but i really think i can do it, i’m just gonna need some help. and bobby’s gonna be here the whole time.

question: look, rachel’s told me how much easier you’ve made all this on her. why can’t you do that for me?
answer: because! ‘cause… ‘cause you’re my baby sister!

question: and you’re my big brother! i mean, you’re my favorite guy in the whole world. i’m not even scared to tell mom and dad. i was scared of telling you.
answer: well i’d be scared of them, but all right.

question: joey, i can’t stand the thought of having this baby with you mad at me. i want him to have his uncle. is my baby gonna have his uncle joey?
answer: of course he’s gonna have his uncle joey!

question: we’re gonna be all right. i mean, even if we’re not married this baby is gonna be so loved. not just by us.
answer: that’s right! by his uncle too!

question: and by you.
answer: okay bobby, why don’t we just come over here and let them have a little moment.

question: oh my god! i do love you! how did you do it?!
answer: well…let’s just say…  rosss caaaaan!

question: oo, where are the seats?
answer: uh, middle balcony.

question: okay, now would you say that that’s more than 50 yards away from sting, his wife, or a member of his family?
answer: yeah.
